comment_0: My favorite of F.S. songs. It's hauntingly beautiful with such bittersweet sentiment. I did not discover (enjoy, really) Frank's music until my 40's, although I grew up watching him and Dean (and their musical friends) on television. Those were the days when you sat around the television set with your family after a meal at the table, and was blessed with the likes of the talented musicians of that decade. It was a time of sweet naivety and innocence, which made Sinatra and the like seem like kings.

comment_6: So few comments for one of the most universally beloved musicians? I though there would be so many.. I grew up on this song, and it's a song I make a tradition of listening to every birthday. Very bittersweet, with lots more sweet than bitter, I think.
comment_7: The final verse makes this song amazing. Here's what I think it means: "I'm in the autumn of the year" gives you an idea of his age; around 3/4ths of his life is over. He says he thinks of his life as vintage wine and that the wine is of a very good year, meaning he believes his life was a very good one. So the title "A Very Good Year" is referring to a life of great value and happiness. I like the metaphor as a life being compared to a year of wine; there are many years and many lives and, just as there are especially good years for wine, this life stood out specifically as a good one.
